name: Zscaler Enforcement Nodes (ZEN) Integration
description: Provides one-click Integration with Zscaler Enforcement Nodes (ZENs). Creates and manages IPsec tunnels to ZEN from the sites and on the circuits that are tagged with AUTO-zscaler

parameters.help_text: API Key from ZScaler Portal
Admin username from ZScaler Portal
Admin password from ZScaler Portal
ZScaler Cloud. E.g. zscalerthree
Customer Domain URL
API Key from ZScaler Portal
Admin username from ZScaler Portal
Admin password obtained from ZScaler Portal
ZScaler Cloud
Partner API Key of Zscaler
Partner Admin account with full permissions on Zscaler Locations and VPN credentials
Partner Admin account password of Zscaler
Zscaler Cloud. E.g. zscalerthree

IPSEC profile to be used by the CloudBlade. If you want to change from the default value of ?ZSCALER_IKEV2? provide the name (case sensitive) of one of the defined IPSEC profiles under Stacked Policies -> IPsec Profiles
Customer Domain URL
Partner API Key of Zscaler
Partner Admin account with full permissions on Zscaler Locations and VPN credentials
Partner Admin account password of Zscaler
Zscaler Cloud. E.g. zscalerthree

IPSEC profile to be used by the CloudBlade. If you want to change from the default value of “ZSCALER_IKEV2” provide the name (case sensitive) of one of the defined IPSEC profiles under Stacked Policies -> IPsec Profiles
If selected administrators can override the IPSEC profile referenced at the 3rd party VPN interface level
Customer Domain URL
Partner API Key of Zscaler
Partner Admin account with full permissions on Zscaler Locations and VPN credentials
Partner Admin account password of Zscaler
Zscaler Cloud. E.g. zscalerthree

IPSEC profile to be used by the CloudBlade. If you want to change from the default value of “ZSCALER_IKEV2” provide the name (case sensitive) of one of the defined IPSEC profiles under Stacked Policies -> IPsec Profiles
If selected administrators can override the IPSEC profile referenced at the 3rd party VPN interface level
Customer Domain URL

name: Prisma Access for Networks (managed by Panorama)
description: Integration with Prisma Access for Networks (managed by Panorama). Requires installation and configuration of On-Premise Docker container "cloudgenix\prisma_access_panorama". For more details, see https://cgx.one/prisma_access_panorama

releases.name: Initial Release
releases.description: First public release for early-access customers. Please use Docker Container "cloudgenix\prisma_access_panorama:1.0.1"

parameters.help_text: Hostname or IP Address of Panorama XML API endpoint.
Username to be used to make IPSEC, IKE, and Prisma Access changes on Panorama. Password must be specified in on-premise container configuration.
parameters.display_label: Panorama Admin Username (password will need to be specified in config.yml or Environment Variables for on-premise container)

parameters.help_text: E-mail address to use as IPSEC Tunnel Identifier on the Prisma Access for Networks (managed by Panorama) endpoints.
parameters.display_label: Tunnel Identifier, Prisma Access for Networks side. Format: text@domain

parameters.help_text: E-mail address to use as a base for generating IPSEC Tunnel Identifiers on the CloudGenix elements.
parameters.display_label: Tunnel Identifier template, CloudGenix Side. Format: text@domain

parameters.help_text: An IP/Prefix range to use for tunnel addresses for tunnels to Prisma Access for Networks. These IP range must not be used in customer network, or as the service range in Prisma Access for Networks.
parameters.display_label: Tunnel inner IP Pool. Must be unique across network. Total tunnels will be limited to this prefix split into /31 prefixes.

parameters.help_text: If CloudGenix cannot detect the Bandwidth on a circuit, this value will be used for circuit bandwidth. Default: 5mbps
parameters.display_label: License Selection Algorithm: Default Bandwidth if circuit bandwidth cannot be detected (mbps).

parameters.help_text: For License selection, modify bandwidth detected by this number, in percent. Default: 100
parameters.display_label: License Selection Algorithm: Detected Bandwidth Offset (percent).

parameters.help_text: Prevent detected bandwidth used for License Selection from ever exceeding this number. Default: 300
parameters.display_label: License Selection Algorithm: Bandwidth License Limit (mbps).

parameters.help_text: If Selected, Licenses closest but smaller than the detected bandwidth will be used. Otherwise, closest license above detected bandwidth will be used.
parameters.display_label: License Selection Algorithm: Best-fit license BELOW circuit bandwidth.

parameters.help_text: If multiple tunnels to Prisma Access for Networks are on a single Circuit, split the license detected bandwdith between the tunnels. Default: False
parameters.display_label: License Selection: Split Circuit bandwidth if multiple tunnels are configured.

parameters.help_text: This value disables all bandwidth detection, and forces best license using "Bandwidth Limit" value above.
parameters.display_label: License Selection: Disable Detection, force all circuits to Bandwidth Limit setting above.

releases.name: Release 2.0.1
releases.description: Enhanced Prisma Access for Remote Networks CloudBlade. Please use Docker Container 'cloudgenix\prisma_access_panorama:2.0.1'

parameters.help_text: Hostname or IP Address of Panorama XML API endpoint.
Username to be used to make IPSEC, IKE, and Prisma Access changes on Panorama. Password must be specified in on-premise container configuration.
E-mail address to use as IPSEC Tunnel Identifier on the Prisma Access for Networks (managed by Panorama) endpoints. Format: text@domain
parameters.display_label: Tunnel Identifier, Prisma Access for Networks side

parameters.help_text: E-mail address to use as a base for generating IPSEC Tunnel Identifiers on the CloudGenix elements. Format: text@domain

An IP/Prefix range to use for tunnel addresses for tunnels to Prisma Access for Networks. These IP range must not be used in customer network, or as the service range in Prisma Access for Networks. Will be split into /31 prefixes.
If using Prisma Access in Multi-tenant mode, please enter the tenant name here. Otherwise, leave blank for standard mode.
This value enforces the ICMP Liveliness Probes on all AUTO_PRISMA endpoints. If set to false, the end user will be able to specify custom Liveliness probes per endpoint.

releases.description: Enhanced Prisma Access for Remote Networks CloudBlade. Please use Docker Container "cloudgenix\prisma_access_panorama:2.0.3"

If using Prisma Access in Multi-tenant mode, please enter the tenant name here. Otherwise, leave blank for standard mode.
This value enforces the ICMP Liveliness Probes on all AUTO_PRISMA endpoints. If set to false, the end user will be able to specify custom Liveliness probes per endpoint.

releases.release_notes: Release notes at Prisma Access CloudBlade Integration Guide

name: Continuous Integration
description: Continuous Integration for Controller configuration management

parameters.help_text: Git Repository Location
SSH private key used to access the Git repository. It expects an RSA key in PEM format. Please ensure the corresponding public key is copied to the Git repository
Name of the Git branch to pull updates from or to push updates to
Specify the folder that should contain all of the site yml configuration files. By default this will be the 'config' folder at the root of the repo
If selected the CloudBlade will create one yml file per branch site and push it to the specified repository path and branch, IF there are NO yml files already present in the repository
parameters.display_label: Auto create yml if no yml in repo path

parameters.help_text: Access Key ID from AWS Portal
Access Key secret obtained from AWS Portal

Transit Gateway ID from AWS Portal. Specify in the format:<aws_region>:<tgwt_id>. For multiple region deployment this will be a comma separated value of format: <aws_region1>:<tgwt_id>, <aws_region2>:<tgwt_id>
Prisma SD-WAN Connect VPC CIDR Block, used for hosting vIONs. We can have a maximum /26 range.
CIDR Block for the GRE Tunnel on AWS Side. It should be not be same as VPC CIDR block. It must have a mask length of 24 or shorter. Invalid block: 1.0.0.0./32
BGP Peer IP Address CIDR between vIONs and TGW. It should have a mask length of 29.
Access Key ID from AWS Portal
Access Key secret obtained from AWS Portal

Transit Gateway ID from AWS Portal. Specify in the format:<aws_region>:<tgwt_id>. For multiple region deployment this will be a comma separated value of format: <aws_region1>:<tgwt_id>, <aws_region2>:<tgwt_id>
Prisma SD-WAN Connect VPC CIDR Block, used for hosting vIONs. We can have a between /16 & /24 range.
CIDR Block for the GRE Tunnel on AWS Side. It should be not be same as VPC CIDR block. It must have a mask length of /8, /16 or /24. Invalid block: 1.0.0.0./32
BGP Peer IP Address CIDR between vIONs and TGW. It should have a mask length of 29.
